title: CMS Finalizes Prior Authorization Requirements for Medicare Advantage Plans Effective 2026
summary: CMS has finalized new requirements for Medicare Advantage plans to streamline prior authorization processes, reduce administrative burden, and improve transparency. Plans must respond to urgent requests within 72 hours and standard requests within 7 days.

title: MetLife PDP Plus Network Changes: What DSOs Need to Know Before Q2 2026
summary: MetLife is updating its PDP Plus network participation requirements, affecting thousands of dental practices. DSOs with Careington umbrella contracts need to verify their coverage path to avoid unexpected claim repricing at lower PDP rates.

title: Cigna Expands Zelis/Maverest Network Access: Impact on Dental and Medical Claims
summary: Cigna has expanded its leasing arrangement with Zelis Healthcare, now including additional dental and medical procedures under the repricing umbrella. Practices with direct Cigna contracts should audit recent EOBs for unexpected network repricing.

title: UnitedHealthcare Expands Prior Auth Requirements for Outpatient Procedures Starting March 1
summary: UnitedHealthcare announced it will expand prior authorization requirements to include additional outpatient surgical procedures and imaging studies effective March 1, 2026. Providers should review updated policy guidelines immediately.

title: Humana Dental Transitions Additional Plans to Zelis Repricing Arrangement
summary: Humana Dental announced it is transitioning additional plan types to utilize Zelis Healthcare's network leasing arrangement for claim repricing. Dental practices should verify which Humana plans remain under direct contract versus leased network access.

title: BCBS Texas Moves to DNOA Network for Dental Claims — Major Routing Change for DSOs
summary: Blue Cross Blue Shield of Texas has completed its migration to DNOA (Dental Network of America) for dental claim routing, affecting thousands of dental practices statewide. Practices should update their network participation verification procedures immediately.

title: OIG Issues New Fraud Alert: Improper Billing for Telehealth Services Under Medicare
summary: The OIG issued a special fraud alert warning providers about improper billing practices for telehealth services, including upcoding, billing for services not rendered, and failing to meet documentation requirements.

title: Denial Rates Hit 5-Year High: New CAQH Index Shows Administrative Burden Accelerating
summary: The 2026 CAQH Index reveals denial rates have reached a 5-year high, with medical necessity denials up 18% year-over-year. Administrative costs now exceed $39 billion annually, driven largely by prior authorization requirements and payor policy complexity.

title: Federal Register: CMS Proposed Rule on Medicare Physician Fee Schedule Updates for 2027
summary: CMS has published its proposed rule for the 2027 Medicare Physician Fee Schedule, including proposed changes to work RVUs, conversion factors, and code valuations for evaluation and management services.

title: AI in Revenue Cycle: 72% of Health Systems Now Using Automation for Claim Submissions
summary: A new HFMA survey finds 72% of health systems have deployed AI for at least one revenue cycle function, up from 41% in 2024. Claim scrubbing, prior authorization, and denial prediction are the top use cases driving adoption.
